subject: Politics
title: Feminism in Politics
description: A short lesson to help you apply Feminism in Politics.

hook.text: Women got the vote in the US in 1920 â€” 144 years after independence. Political equality took a long fight.

buildup.text: Political feminism demands equal representation, rights, and power for women in government and law.

discovery.text: First-wave feminism won voting rights. Second-wave tackled workplace equality. Third-wave addressed intersectionality.

twist.text: Women hold only 26% of parliamentary seats worldwide. Legal equality hasn't produced actual representation.

climax.text: Countries with more women in power tend to invest more in education, health, and social services.

punchline.text: Feminism won legal equality. Real political power is still catching up.

quiz.question: What percentage of parliamentary seats worldwide are held by women?
